availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
County of Mercer SS
At a county court held for Mercer county at the court House in Harrodsburg on Monday March 6th 1865 Present Hon. Thomas Edwards Judge the following proceedings were had to wit:

"It having come to the knowledge of this court that John C. Gabbart sheriff of Mercer county has departed this life it is ordered by the court that Thomas J. Vanarsdale be and he is hereby appointed Sheriff of Mercer county to fill the vacancy created by the death of said John C. Gabbart until the next august election according to law:
In testimony whereof I have herewith set my hand and the seal of our said court at Harrodsburg this 7th day of March A. D. 1865

C. S. Abell clerk
Mercer county court Ky.

Mercer County vs Thos J. Vanarsdale
apptd
Sheriff
7th Mch 1865
